gurmukhi: swqk Aau muslI rQ pY bsudyv qy Awidk Dwie sBY ]brmw kiRq aUDv Aaur AkRUr cly rn kau Bir lwj qbY ]
transliteration: Saatak Au Mouslirath Pai Basudev Te Aadik Dhaae Sabhai|| Bramaa Krit Oodhav Aur Akroor Chale Ran Kau Bbhar(i) Laaj Tabai||
translation: Balram, Vasudev, Satyam etc., marched forward and Udhava and Akrur etc. also for war-arena;

gurmukhi: iqh bIc iGirE niRp rwjq Xo liK rIJ rhY Bt qwih CbY ]mn XoN aupjI aupmw irq pwvs ABRn mY idn rwj PbY ]1161]
transliteration: Tih Beech Ghirio Nrip Raajatt Yo Lakh(i) Reejh Rahai Bhat Mai Din Raaj Phabai||1161||
translation: Besieged by all of them, the king Anag Singh appears like sun surrounded by clouds in the rainy season.1161.

gurmukhi: hl pwn sMBwr lXo muslI rn mY Air kY hX cwro hI Gwey ]bwn kmwn ghI bsudyv Bly rQ ky ck kwit igrwey ]
transliteration: Hl Paan Sanbhaar Layo Mousliran Mai Ar(i) Kai Haya Chdaro Highaae|| Baan Karmaan Gadibasudev Bhale Rath Ke Chak Kaattee Giraae||
translation: Balram took his plough in his hand and killed all the four horses of the enemy; Vasudev with his bow and arrows cut down all the four wheels of the chariot;

gurmukhi: swqk sUq ko sIs ktXo irs aUDv bwn Anyk clwey ]PwND prXo rQ qy qqkwl ley As Fwl bfy Bt Gwey ]1162]
transliteration: Saatak Soot Ko Sees Katyo Ris Oodhav Baan Anek Chadhaae|| Phaandh Daryo Rath Te Tatkaal Lae As Dhaal Bade Bhat Ghaae||1162||
translation: Satyak chopped the head of his charioteer and Udhava also in his fury discharged many arrows; the king Anag Singh jumped instantly out of his chariod and killed may warriors with the sword.1162.

gurmukhi: TwFo huqo Bt sRI jdubIr ko so Axgys jU nYn inhwrXo ]pwien kI kir cMclqw br so As S`qR ky sIs pHwrXo ]
transliteration: Thaadho Houto Bhat Srijadoubeer Ko So Anes Joo Nain Nihdaryo|| Paain Kikar(i) Channdhaltaa Bar So As Shattra Ke Sees Prahdaryo||
translation: The king Anag Singh saw the warriors of Krishna standing, he then speedily struck the blow of his sword on the head of the enemy;

gurmukhi: tUt prXo Jt dY kit Xo isr qw Cib ko kib Bwau aucwrXo ]mwnhu rwhu insw kr ko niB mMfl qy hin kY iCq fwrXo ]1163]
transliteration: Toot Daryo Jhat Dai Kattee Yo Sir Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kabi Bhaau Ouchdaryo|| Maanoh Raahu Nisaa Kar Ko Nabh(i) Mandal Te Han(i) Kai Chhit Ddaryo||1163||
translation: The head of the enemy fell on the ground like Rahu killing and throwing down on the earth, the moon from the sky.1163.

gurmukhi: kUd cVXo Ar ky rQ aUpr swrQI kau bD kY qb hI ]Dn bwn kiRpwn gdw brCI Ar ky kir SsqR ley sB hI ]
transliteration: Kood Chadyo Ar Ke Rath Oopar Saarathikau Badh Kai Tab Hee|| Dhan Baan Kridaan Gadaa Barchhiar Ke Kar(i) Shastra Lae Sabh Hee||
translation: After killing the charioteer of the enemy, the king mounted on his chariot and carried his weapons bow and arrows, sword, mace and spear in his hands;

gurmukhi: rQ Awp hI hwk kY sXwm khY mD jwdv sYn prXo jb hI ]iek mwr ley iek Bwj gey iek TwFy Bey qyaU nwd bhI ]1164]
transliteration: Rath Aap Hihaak Kai Syaam Kahai Madh Jaadav Sain Daryo Jab Hee|| Ik Maar Lae Ik Bhaaj Gad Ik Thaadhe Teoo Naad Bahee||1164||
translation: He himself began to drive his chariot within the Yadava army; with his blows someone was killed, someone fled away and someone being wonder-struck, kept standing.1164.

gurmukhi: Awpn hI rQ hwkq hY Aru Awpn hI sir jwl clwvY ]Awpn hI irp Gwie bcwvq Awpn hI Air Gwie lgwvY ]
transliteration: Oopan Hirath Haakat Hai Ar(u) Aapan Hisar(i) Jaal Chalaavai|| Oopan Hirip Ghaae Badhaavadaapan Hiar(i) Ghaae Lagadvai||
translation: Now he himself is driving the chariot and showering his arrows; he himself is safe from the blows of the enemy and is himself inflicting blows on the enemy;

gurmukhi: eykn ky Dnu bwn kty Bt eykn ky rQ kwt igrwvY ]dwmn ijau dmkY Gn mY kr mY krvwrih iqau cmkwvY ]1165]
transliteration: Ekan Ke Dhan(u) Baan Kate Bhat Ekan Ke Rath Kaat Giraavai|| Daamanndjio Damkai Ghan Mai Kar Mai Karvaarah(i) Tio Chmkaavai||1165||
translation: He has chopped the bow of some warrior and has shattered someoneâ€™s chariot; the sword in his hand is shining like the flash of lightning amongst the coulds.1165.
